document.title: English Language Arts Program of Study

64E3C60ED2514A6BBA047E528009B717.description:
respond to questions about
personal contributions to
group process

C3C50D6E46454B60A3F041B96838AB05.description: listen to the ideas of others

D25937B3900F4C51843D2740C883D741.description:
ask and answer questions to
determine what the class
knows about a topic

2297EFA71A9F4E88B29521FCA9F386BB.description:
find ways to be helpful to
others

986FEB5AEBFA48748D1B36BE9F4DB79D.description:
participate in class and group
activities

3F88293E8E36446B97ED00B22E93E50F.description:
use appropriate words, phrases
and statements with adults and
peers when speaking and
listening, sharing and taking
turns

679C35ACBBCF486B80AB1B279EB5AE0C.description:
share stories, using rhymes,
rhythms, symbols, pictures
and drama to celebrate
individual and class
accomplishments

937D2DA751CF4696864DD5D670080573.description:
explore oral, print and other
media texts from various
communities

8C12ABDE8A7D40C5BFA7A5202E5B7C81.description:
explore personal experiences
and family traditions related to
oral, print and other media
texts

75D30788A48441BEAE8CDFF50A39FF6F.description:
make comments that relate to
the topic being discussed

A42A77C45D0841E59A428470AC6FA663.description:
speak in a clear voice to share
ideas and information

775472E18F97412EA68FCDA46E2E7ABE.description: Use effective oral and visual communication

E13FF250E1E14CF9BD02743F0699EC04.description:
use drawings to illustrate ideas
and information, and talk
about them

5A8F12D533574840A33528464F1DDD0F.description:

about own drawings and
topics of personal interest

F1FAAF9322A84670ADB1DE7E718A2668.description:
capitalize first letter of own
name

AAE118873F8A402591BC081C489953C8.description:

periods in print texts

1F8D7676A67748F9875AAC9F3004830F.description:

environmental print and words
with personal significance

CB0A928AC69740C281A3CCA2BE53471E.description:
connect letters with sounds in
words

ABC4D320FF024F2A81C95F2FF7EF3D8C.description:
demonstrate curiosity about
visual features of letters and
words with personal
significance

A2A43CE86022417E8676958C4ED03B89.description:
hear and identify dominant
sounds in spoken words

A6F3581344CD4D71981920346E2A43D7.description:
experiment with sounds,
colours, print and pictures to
express ideas and feelings

E47B13C10E664D1087D275093EC9188B.description:
experiment with rhymes and
rhythms of language to learn
new words

468FF7CF5B8F4630A078CE27DE2A402D.description:
explore and experiment with
new words and terms
associated with topics of
interest

3667636CF6AE4382A957B78E23225434.description:
explore the keyboard, using
letters, numbers and the space
bar

863A99AF2FFD4B02B566F1B72BEBE45E.description:
form recognizable letters by
holding a pen or pencil in an
appropriate and comfortable
manner

044D9E1591F54FD7B71AB1A8CE7F9451.description:
retell ideas to clarify meaning
in response to questions or
comments

8501248C27A0452D83C597B1A364F98D.description:
make statements related to the
content of own and others’
pictures, stories or talk

654399004457488BBB623DBFD4CD8B05.description:
share ideas and information
about topics of interest

9C9570A15CB64A8D8855364550AE7686.description:
represent and talk about ideas
and information; dictate to a
scribe

8064FC3206DC485EB8473469BE6DA43D.description:
categorize objects and pictures
according to visual similarities
and differences

35CFC2879A9B443BAF6BFAF2EDC22B91.description:
ask questions to make sense of
information

2E42C476F47B433F9F68A5B853E818F7.description:
use illustrations, photographs,
video programs, objects and
auditory cues, to access
information

6FECB49B83B04C0FA59DFE9E2362FFBA.description:
seek information from a
variety of sources, such as
people at school, at home, in
the community, picture books,
photographs and videos

0E4A8F9E2D2D49A1B02FC35FBD7A7DD5.description:
suggest ways to gather ideas
and information

CE8BC792D2BA4FFDB0007A0CE2ECF1EC.description:
ask questions to satisfy
personal curiosity

BDDAC8000F414ACF85858AF6D56ED508.description:
make statements about topics
under discussion

D7C3172E8EBA4C21A6C07680A253C103.description:
attend to oral, print and other
media texts on topics of
interest

0C0E64413A264388AF5E972110E3C0DD.description:
talk about and explain the
meaning of own pictures and
print

D8815185096646D19598EF64FEE62DC3.description:
draw, record or tell about
ideas and experiences

6CB8AFD615354B3882AE6CAF15A023D3.description:
listen to and recite short
poems, songs and rhymes; and
engage in word play and
action songs

D2E88BAF804E402F8A04D45ABDDD23A4.description: Elaborate on the expression of ideas

674F0F78AC3349FA8815D561FF2F8A56.description:
contribute ideas and answer
questions related to
experiences and familiar oral,
print and other media texts

72B2D359776E4A44B2E39909344063C3.description:
appreciate the sounds and
rhythms of language in shared
language experiences, such as
nursery rhymes and personal
songs

92C11AF1873943A6A3FEABD996BFABB9.description:
identify the main characters in
a variety of oral, print and
other media texts

287E0B261FCE4B67AAA851D2022179DD.description:
develop a sense of story
through reading, listening and
viewing experiences

DDD8A9FFA2004E91BB8FE34F65FF4942.description:
experience a variety of oral,
print and other media texts
x

81C336436C984F07B290ED34A79E83D2.description:
talk about experiences similar
or related to those in oral,
print and other media texts

1FE92F8CE4F24AEDB171107E9483A506.description:
talk about and represent the
actions of characters portrayed
in oral, print and other media
texts

627C16C75A714081AFC02267D44A08DB.description:
experiment with sounds,
words, word patterns, rhymes
and rhythms

C883FC430964452A85F2B019CC5FEF68.description:
relate aspects of oral, print and
other media texts to personal
feelings and experiences

FF0F5F688C9D4D009328C37E6DB5D586.description:
participate in shared listening,
reading and viewing
experiences, using oral, print
and other media texts from a
variety of cultural traditions
and genres, such as picture
books, fairy tales, rhymes,
stories, photographs,
illustrations and video
programs

858C694FD8DF477B95BFA0E809A451D8.description:
copy scribed words and print
texts to assist with writing

21A36A99A3DA4CB6BEC12367DECCEE96.description:
recite the letters of the
alphabet in order

E88F6565BA7541AAB0ED55473EDE62E7.description:
associate sounds with
consonants that appear at the
beginning of personally
significant words

AD44EE79A96741DB9530D5C6A9EBF4E9.description:
hear and identify sounds in
words

6BC4781723CE47F5BFF6D9B1115836E2.description:
identify and generate rhyming
words in oral language

5EB530C7DAF24C7AAF245AE520F5973A.description:
begin to make connections
among sounds, letters, words,
pictures and meaning

14658CECFAE94A4FB300A53D8F414C44.description:
begin to identify some
individual words in texts that
have been read aloud

306727D8D4674300B43F906E5C465FF8.description:
attend to print cues when
stories are read aloud

7AFD49C8919E45F3AF86DB00FD2BE66F.description:
read own first name,
environmental print and
symbols, words that have
personal significance and
some words in texts

683A9567DFB440388CA8C3C79AC5F7B6.description:
recall events and characters in
familiar stories read aloud by
others

7FA978A40B474F36BEAB4D9E5B68BFE1.description:
ask questions and make
comments during listening and
reading activities

5DF5E80FFBCA4A31B25C55C8BAC8EAE9.description:
begin to use language
prediction skills when stories
are read aloud

C2EED948EDCD4A2BB7331EAEFF239FE9.description:
understand that print and
books are organized in
predictable ways

CCBECB222D454E449DB87DF265C817D7.description:
expect print and pictures to
have meaning and to be
related to each other in print
and other media texts

FE5311FB1FBB443199378B33E2B6816C.description:
understand that stories,
information and personal
experiences can be recorded in
pictures and print and can be
listened to, read or viewed

2FA7F6B88EF94BE297F6173382BC1730.description:
connect oral language with
print and pictures

7DFBB7596B8E487D9F8B20212366BB74.description: express interest in new ideas and experiences

A20FA493E98C4CFCAE2C5763A6391682.description:
listen to experiences and
feelings shared by others

4F98E40B46D844079E1575E0DA97B7CF.description: talk about own reading and writing experiences

82A1C50F1BD04270BE5DC2B3786B5CB6.description:
talk about favourite oral, print
and other media texts

10CD9E58BCCF41B39E317AAE598D2DDD.description:
talk and represent to explore,
express and share stories,
ideas and experiences

05660B708F744D7397B8FD0D8322A380.description:
talk about ideas, experiences
and familiar events

11391BDEB95147F99B152CB7E545BB8C.description:
share personal experiences
